chargeHist.descr: Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle
Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle

result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Daniel Blietz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
- $268.00 Court Costs, Payable through DOC as a condition of Probation in 22CF19 Count 2. 
- $250.00 DNA Surcharge, Payable through DOC as a condition of Probation in 22CF19 Count 2.

- DNA Sample
- Absolute Sobriety
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting
- Subject to Random UA's and PBT's
- Not to use or possess firearm
- Obtain psychological/psychiatric evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested 
- Obtain GED or HSED
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
- Participate in Restorative Justice program
- Upon Release of Extended Supervision, Defendant to sign up for Treatment Court and complete successfully
- Defendant to be fitted with Alcohol monitor device once released from prison

supervisions.notes:
If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

8:43 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Benjamin Daniel Blietz in court, in custody.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court for Benjamin Daniel Blietz. Special Prosecuting attorney Michelle P Brekken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes Agent Volz is here in person. Neither Atty Brekken nor Atty Perrin believe any changes need to be made to PSI.  SP Brekken makes statements regarding letter submitted from Kristy Toby.  Atty Perrin responds and makes statements, requesting to have letter sealed and that the Court disregard it.  OFF RECORD at 8:54 AM.  Back on record at 9:37 AM, all appearances as previously stated.  Court addresses parties and makes statements regarding Motions and letters filed. OFF RECORD at 9:41 AM.  On RECORD at 9:54 AM, appearances previously stated. Special Prosecutor Brekken states there are discrepancies between the 2 PSI's.  Atty Perrin responds. SP Brekken recites recommendation and gives sentencing arguments.  PL Exhibit # 7, Exhibit # 9. PL Exhibits # 1-6, #8, & #10. PL Exhibits # 12, 13, 14, & 15. PL Exhibit #16.  Continued sentencing argument. SP Brekken recites Victim Impact Statement.  B. N. reads Victim Impact Statement written by Victims uncle. Off Record at 11:23 AM.  Back On Record at 11:45 AM, appearances as previously stated, C. L. reads Victim Impact statement from victim's cousin.  M. L. reads Victim Impact Statement, Victims brother.  J.L makes Victim Impact Statement, Victims dad. Court breaks for lunch at 12:04 PM.  Back ON Record at 1:08 PM.  Atty Perrin makes sentencing arguments. Court questions Atty Perrin.  Atty Perrin responds.  A.P. makes statements, friend of DE.  M.S. makes statements, DE's friend.  K.R. makes statements, DE's biological mother. DE makes statements. Court questions attorney's.  Off Record at 1:49 PM. Back on record at 1:56 PM.  Atty Perrin makes statements.  ADA Brekken has nothing further.  Atty Perrin has nothing further.  Court takes a recess at 1:57 PM. Back on record at 2:28 PM.  Court makes statements and reads maximum penalty for charge.  DE is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program nor Substance Abuse Program. Restitution to be held open for 60 days. 

Court Orders: Ct 2 in 22CF19

T/S- 16 Years; Initial Confinement- 10 Years; Extended Supervision- 6 Years

Costs: $268
DNA Surcharge: $250 
Payable through probation 

Conditions of Extended Supervision:

- DNA Sample
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting. 
- AODA and follow through 
- Subject to Random UA's and PBT's
- DE to complete a Psychological/ Psychiatric Evaluation 
- Not to use or possess firearms. 
- Any other evaluation or treatment agent requests DE to complete
- Must get GED and HSD
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license 
- Restorative Services
- Upon release of Extended supervision, DE to sign up for treatment court and complete successfully
- DE to be fitted with device to monitor alcohol once released from prison

281 Days credit against ultimate sentence

Adjourned at 2:55 PM

3:49 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Attorney Michelle P Brekken in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court for Benjamin Daniel Blietz. Defendant Benjamin Daniel Blietz in court, in custody. Victim Witness appeared with Victim. Includes 22CF19, 22TR170, 22TR171, and 22TR172. Court reviews case. Atty Brekken states there is a resolution. ADA Brekken states there will be no limitation or cap from the state and anticipating restitution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to 22CF19 Count 2: Homicide by Intoxicated use of vehicle- 940.09(1)(a).Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses and read-in 22CF19 Counts 1, 3-5. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses cases 22TR170, 22TR171, and 22TR172.  Court orders PSI.  Victim makes statement. ADA Brekken request to revoke bail. Court revokes bond. Court sets PLEAS. Adjourned 04:09 PM

Pretrial Assessment Report. SEALED.  gll
Preliminary hearing on January 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least FIVE times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Victim's family including C.C. or J.L. or their residences.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:03 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Michelle Brekken  DF ATTY: Scott Selmer for today   DF:  Benjamin Daniel Blietz appeared from jail. Includes 22CF19, 22TR170, 22TR171, and 22TR172. Victim's father and aunt appeared with Pam of VW. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond argument; ADA Brekken states Defendant has active warrant in Washington state outstanding from 2015 and currently on a DJOC in 20CM569. Victim's father and aunt make statements. Atty Selmer responds. Court questions attys. Court orders cash bond. Atty Selmer doesn't know who will be assigned. Court sets Preliminary Hearing. Court enters NG pleas on traffic matters- to trail. Adjourned at 1:28 PM.  gll  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
